title: Smurfing should be banned
body:
Just invited a friend to start playing the game, He quit within 2 housr due to smurfs dominating low level gameplay.

Really good look for new players, Getting facerolled by smurfs.

Report Smurfs, Get Smurfing banned for good.

ONE ACCOUNT PER PLAYER!

replies.body:
Riot should simply just accept that smurfing is a thing and make it easier to control/police.

When people start another account, allow them to link it to their main, doing so would give them an instant level 30.
However any and all punishments given to smurf accounts will now apply to all linked accounts, so they can't be toxic and troll and say "i don't care its only a smurf".

Hey, we recently talked about smurfs here - http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/community/q/lets-talk-smurfs-snow-and-bans-ask-riot

I've quoted the relevant question and answer for you.

**Is smurfing okay? Why don’t you have better solutions in place for this?**

(Note: This question generated a lot of interesting internal dialogue. So we wanted to include two Rioters in an edited conversation for this question, to highlight that we don’t always have all the answers.)
It’s complicated.

**WookieeCookie:** We don’t endorse smurfing, but tackling it is a very difficult issue because of our player population size and the ease of account creation. We agree that smurfing can really ruin the game, such as when a smurf stomps lower-tier players. However; from past attempts we've learned that it's a real uphill battle to create powerful restrictions on alt-accounts without inadvertently affecting the majority of our players who don't smurf at all.
Instead of cumbersome systems to blanket restrict smurfing we're looking for targeted answers that attack specific pain points. For example, if we find a player is using a smurf to actively hurt the game and other players we’ll take direct action on that account, and in some cases their main account as well.

**Ghostcrawler:** Sometimes players are smurfing because they are trying to accomplish something that League isn’t offering - in other words, the need is unmet. For example, playing with a friend with a different skill set is a noble pursuit that League doesn’t support very well. Other players might make a smurf account because they want a sense of rapid progression that they experienced when leveling from 1-30 or maybe even climbing through Bronze and Silver.
So we should be careful not to paint all smurfs with broad strokes and assume that they are trying to grief actual new players. They may have other intentions. That said, taken on the whole, I’m not a fan of smurfing and worry the potential harm to other players outweighs the benefits to those players with unmet needs.

**WookieeCookie:** Agreed! That’s why we can’t endorse it. Instead of trying to restrict or prevent smurfs, various teams across Riot try to minimize issues caused by smurfing. For example, one of the teams that works on meta-game systems developed pretty good detection methods that quickly separate new players from experienced smurf accounts in the early levels. Within a few matches, smurf accounts only end up playing against other smurf accounts.

> [{quoted}](name=That Bronze Kid,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=W8Lln5IH,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2016-06-03T02:20:27.288+0000)

> Really saying that Smurfing is not toxic is like turning a blind eye.
> 
> All the people smurfs in low level games are swearing, abusing other players for not being good, purposefully trolling 1 lane (5 man camping mid lane wth?)

This is what's called a "stereotype". You're generalising a collective/group based on the actions of the "few". While I would tend to agree that *more often than not* smurf accounts are used to break the rules, that doesn't hold true for *all* smurfs. Personally, I have 5 accounts (being one "main" and 4 "smurfs") yet I actively avoid breaking the rules on all those accounts. In fact, I'm using one of my smurf accounts to make this post.

> Really i don't see why Riot just doesn't man the hell up and put a stop to it, people wont try it if they are threatened with a ban

The reason Riot doesn't just "ban all smurfs" is because there's nothing wrong with the act of smurfing. The issues arise with how players use those extra accounts. It is, in fact, a case of "many bad apples ruin the bunch". I pointed this out in my original response.

I would, however, agree that individuals that use multiple accounts should face more severe punishments, as they simply have the option to "avoid" punishments by using a different account, and those punishments should be even more severe if the behaviour exists across more than one of the accounts they use.

The reason Riot doesn't just "ban all smurfs" is because there's nothing wrong with the act of smurfing.

Yes and no iv seen countless streams when master+ players make a account lv it to 30 and help bronze players get to plat thats boosting in a way but tencent dose not deal with it.

That not an issue with smurfing in itself, though. It's an issue with the way the accounts are being used. The same thing can be done using only one account and simply throwing games to get demoted to a level that they could queue with low rank players.
Lets face it your mate was bad at the game i remember my first game i went 0 10 0 vs bots the skill.

> [{quoted}](name=That Bronze Kid,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=W8Lln5IH,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-06-03T01:53:06.258+0000)
>
> Just invited a friend to start playing the game, He quit within 2 housr due to smurfs dominating low level gameplay.

How do you know it was due to smurfs dominating low level gameplay? Were you queue'd with them?

If you were queue'd with them then riot would balance it out by making you vs low level players and at least one lvl 30+....

According to Riot there are "pretty good detection methods" in place that separate new players from smurfs in pre-30 games (as stated in their recent [news post](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/community/q/lets-talk-smurfs-snow-and-bans-ask-riot) that touched on smurf accounts).

Given that you say your friend quit within 2 hours, that tends to suggest that such detections systems might not have had enough data to properly place them amongst other *new* players. This would hold even more true if you had queued with them.

That said, there's nothing wrong with the act of smurfing itself, it's what people do with those extra accounts that makes the difference. Someone who uses multiple accounts to break the rules (such as intentionally making the experience worse for new players) are the "bad apples" that ruin the bunch. As pointed out in Riots news post, however, it's not as simple as "all smurfs break the rules" as a person might make additional account(s) because of a "need" the game doesn't meet.

G'day,

I presume things like this are hard to control. Even if there was one account per IP address, what about shared houses and the such?

The only way to get through this is to persevere until you get up higher.
